project_abstract.cdata: The Primary Education Development Project's objectives are to: a) improve school quality and system efficiency; b) establish a sustainable, cost-effective and better managed education system; and c) ensure universal coverage and equitable access to quality primary schooling.  The first project components -- improving school quality and system efficiency -- will provide teacher development and school cluster based training; improve curriculum; and strengthen national institutions to ensure quality primary education and teacher training.  The second component -- strengthening institutional capacity and management -- will be done at central, district, thana, and school levels.  Activities will focus on strengthening management skills and improving information systems.  The third component -- increasing equitable access -- will include construction of new schools and additional classrooms in under-served areas for hard-to-reach children; block grants to schools to support the provision of stationery to the poorest students; and social mobilization.
